metadata.title: CVE-2024-42224 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: dsa: mv88e6xxx: Correct check for empty listSince commit a3c53be55c95 ("net: dsa: mv88e6xxx: Support multiple MDIObusses") mv88e6xxx_default_mdio_bus() has checked that thereturn value of list_first_entry() is non-NULL.This appears to be intended to guard against the list chip->mdios beingempty.  However, it is not the correct check as the implementation oflist_first_entry is not designed to return NULL for empty lists.Instead, use list_first_entry_or_null() which does return NULL if thelist is empty.Flagged by Smatch.Compile tested only.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42224` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1181-azure - 4.15.0-1181.196~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1181.196~14.04.1').
